thread.title: NBL team’s bizarre online job ad
thread.title_full: NBL team’s bizarre online job ad

title: NBL team’s bizarre online job ad
text:
Adelaide 36ers’ head coaching job advertised on SEEK Olgun Uluc, FOX SPORTS February 28, 2017 1:12pm 
HAVE you ever wanted to apply to be a head coach in the NBL? 
Now you can, after the Adelaide 36ers placed an advertisement for their head coaching position on the online employment marketplace, SEEK . 
The advertisement asks that those who apply have at least 10 years’ coaching experience in professional basketball coaching, and that the person has coached in the NBL before. 
This comes as a surprise because the 36ers’ current head coach, Joey Wright, is coming off a regular season where he led his team to a league-best 17-11 record, before bowing out in the semi-finals. 
However, despite the inexplicable advertisement, Wright is set to garner a new, multi-year deal, after his impressive 2016-17 NBL season, sources told foxsports.com.au . 
NEW PODCAST! Terrance Ferguson joins the show to talk about his time in Australia, his improvement over the season, and his NBA Draft preparations. Then, the Overtime crew breaks down all of the deals that went down before the Trade Deadline. 
Subscribe to the podcast on iTunes by CLICKING HERE. media_camera 
Notwithstanding, it’s unusual to see a position of this level of esteem advertised publicly. 
You can technically apply for the position HERE . 
***
